result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody A. SPENCER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same at the agent's discretion.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with M.N., K.P., N.H., D.N., Danielle Gallops, Jay's Legacy Property and Trenton Ploederl.
AODA assessment and counseling at the agent's discretion.

$170.00 to Richard Zachow at 1457 Iris Drive, Manitowoc, WI; joint and several with Payton Spencer.
$1,627.24 to City of Manitowoc Parks and Recreation Dept. at 2655 S. 35th Street, Manitowoc, WI; joint and several with Trenton Ploederl.
$405.34 to City of Manitowoc Parks and Recreation Dept. at 2655 S. 35th Street, Manitowoc, WI; joint and several with  Trenton Ploederl.

State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT -

Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Parties argue the motion.
The Court comments and modifies bail to $150.00 cash with the added conditions that he follow a daily curfew of between 10:00 p.m. through 8:00 a.m. and provide a letter from his grandparents stating they are allowing him to reside with them prior to release.  
Attorney Pangburn to draft the appropriate order.

RE:  605 Reed Avenue, Manitowoc, WI, on 07-17-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of arson, burglary, contribute to deliquency of a child, 3 counts bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-27-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $400.00 cash with the condition that he have no contact with anyone under the age of 18.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
